translated: If you say that the cognition of sound is a cognition of a quality, then it would be conceptual, because it is a cognition of a quality.üîΩIf you say that the cognition of sound is nonconceptual, then it would not be a cognition of sound, because it is not a cognition of an action.üîΩIf you say that the cognition of sound is a cognition of an action, then it would be conceptual, because it is a cognition of an action.

original: re zhig so sor ni ma yin te zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: re zhig so sor ni ma yin te zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: If you say that the cognition of sound is nonconceptual, then it would not be a cognition of sound, because it is not a cognition of a universal property.üîΩIf you say that the cognition of sound is a cognition of a universal property, then it would be conceptual, because it is a cognition of a universal property.üîΩIf you say that the cognition of sound is nonconceptual, then it would not be a cognition of sound, because it is not a cognition of a particular property.

original: gang phyir bde ba la sogs pa re re 'dzin na ni /
analyzed: gang phyir bde ba la sogs pa re re 'dzin na ni /
translated: If you say that the cognition of sound is a cognition of a particular property, then it would be conceptual, because it is a cognition of a particular

original: dbang po'i 'jug pa rnams rang gi yul kho na la 'jug par 'gyur ba ma yin te /
analyzed: dbang po'i 'jug pa rnams rang gi yul kho na la 'jug par 'gyur ba ma yin te /
translated: The engagement of the sense faculties does not engage only their own objects,

original: thams cad du bde ba la sogs pa rnams khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad du bde ba la sogs pa rnams khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because pleasure, etc. are not distinguished in all cases.

original: de yang 'dod de /
analyzed: de yang 'dod de /
translated: That is also accepted.

original: de'i phyir bde ba la sogs pa so sor gzung bar bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir bde ba la sogs pa so sor gzung bar bya ba ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, pleasure, etc. are not to be individually apprehended.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What then?

original: sgra la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: sgra la sogs pa ste /
translated: Sound, etc.

original: de'i phyir de rnams kho na so sor yongs su gyur pa sgra la sogs pa'i rang dngos rnams su 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa ma yin zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir de rnams kho na so sor yongs su gyur pa sgra la sogs pa'i rang dngos rnams su 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa ma yin zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: Therefore, it is said that only those individually transformed into the nature of sound, etc. become the intrinsic natures of sound, etc.

original: lnga rnams gsum gyi bkod pa'i khyad par rnams //
analyzed: lnga rnams gsum gyi bkod pa'i khyad par rnams //
translated: The five are the distinctions of the arrangement of the three.

original: zhes khas blangs pa'i phyir 'di yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: zhes khas blangs pa'i phyir 'di yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Since this is accepted, this is not the case.

original: des 'di skad bshad par 'gyur te /
analyzed: des 'di skad bshad par 'gyur te /
translated: This is explained as follows:

original: gang sgra la sogs pa'i rang dngos su mi 'gyur ba de rna ba la sogs pa'i 'jug pas gzung bar bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: gang sgra la sogs pa'i rang dngos su mi 'gyur ba de rna ba la sogs pa'i 'jug pas gzung bar bya ba ma yin te /
translated: That which does not become the intrinsic nature of sound, etc. is not to be apprehended by the engagement of the ear, etc.,

original: sems pa can nyid bzhin /
analyzed: sems pa can nyid bzhin /
translated: like sentience.

original: bde ba la sogs pa yang so sor sgra la sogs pa'i rang dngos su 'gyur ba ma yin no zhes pa khyab par byed pa med pa'o //
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa yang so sor sgra la sogs pa'i rang dngos su 'gyur ba ma yin no zhes pa khyab par byed pa med pa'o //
translated: Pleasure, etc. also are not the individual own-nature of sound, etc. This is the absence of the pervasion.

original: ma yin te gzhan ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir zhes pas ma grub pa smras so //
analyzed: ma yin te gzhan ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir zhes pas ma grub pa smras so //
translated: It is not so, because of non-difference. Thus he states the non-establishment.

original: gang sgra la sogs pa las gzhan ma yin pa de rna ba la sogs pa'i 'jug pa'i gzung bar bya ba yin te /
analyzed: gang sgra la sogs pa las gzhan ma yin pa de rna ba la sogs pa'i 'jug pa'i gzung bar bya ba yin te /
translated: Whatever is not different from sound, etc. is the object apprehended by the engagement of the ear, etc.

original: sgra la sogs pa bzhin /
analyzed: sgra la sogs pa bzhin /
translated: Like sound, etc.

original: bde ba la sogs pa'i rang gi dngos po yang de lta bu'o //
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa'i rang gi dngos po yang de lta bu'o //
translated: The own-nature of pleasure, etc. is also like that.

original: rang bzhin no //
analyzed: rang bzhin no //
translated: It is the nature.

original: gzhan min zhe na zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan min zhe na zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: If it is said that it is not different, etc.

original: gang sgra la sogs pa las gzhan ma yin pa de'i rgyu ma yin te /
analyzed: gang sgra la sogs pa las gzhan ma yin pa de'i rgyu ma yin te /
translated: Whatever is not different from sound, etc. is not the cause of that,

original: sgra la sogs pa bzhin /
analyzed: sgra la sogs pa bzhin /
translated: like sound, etc.

original: bde ba la sogs pa yang de lta bu'o zhes pa 'gal bas khyab pa gsungs so //
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa yang de lta bu'o zhes pa 'gal bas khyab pa gsungs so //
translated: Pleasure, etc. is also like that. Thus he states the pervasion by contradiction.

original: de las kyang khas blangs pa dang 'gal lo //
analyzed: de las kyang khas blangs pa dang 'gal lo //
translated: Moreover, it contradicts what you accept.

original: gang brjod pa zhes pa la sogs pas ni rgyu nyid du khas blangs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gang brjod pa zhes pa la sogs pas ni rgyu nyid du khas blangs pa gsungs te /
translated: ‚ÄúThat which is expressed‚Äù and so on explains the assertion of the cause.

original: snying stobs sgra'i 'bras bur bshad nas /
analyzed: snying stobs sgra'i 'bras bur bshad nas /
translated: Having explained that sattva is the result of sound,

original: sgra'i bdag nyid du gnas pas ni /
analyzed: sgra'i bdag nyid du gnas pas ni /
translated: it is said that since it abides as the nature of sound,

original: rdul dang mun pa dag sgra las byung ba'i ched du 'jug par 'chad par byed do //
analyzed: rdul dang mun pa dag sgra las byung ba'i ched du 'jug par 'chad par byed do //
translated: rajas and tamas engage for the sake of sound.

original: rdul sgra'i 'bras bur bshad nas zhes pa la sogs pa thams cad snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: rdul sgra'i 'bras bur bshad nas zhes pa la sogs pa thams cad snga ma bzhin no //
translated: Having explained that rajas is the result of sound, all of this is as before.

original: 'di ni khyad par te /
analyzed: 'di ni khyad par te /
translated: This is the difference:

original: @65b rdul gyis snying stobs dang mun pa dag sgra'i dngos po'i ched du 'jug par byed do //
analyzed: @65b rdul gyis snying stobs dang mun pa dag sgra'i dngos po'i ched du 'jug par byed do //
translated: rajas engages for the sake of the entity of sound, sattva and tamas.

original: mun pa ni snying stobs dang rdul dag dgra la yod pa'i ched du rnam bar 'jog par byed do zhes pa'o //
analyzed: mun pa ni snying stobs dang rdul dag dgra la yod pa'i ched du rnam bar 'jog par byed do zhes pa'o //
translated: Tamas is posited for the sake of the enemies, sattva and rajas.

original: ci ste gzhan nyid ma yin pa nyid na yang 'bras bu dang rgyu'i dngos por 'dod cing /
analyzed: ci ste gzhan nyid ma yin pa nyid na yang 'bras bu dang rgyu'i dngos por 'dod cing /
translated: But if they are not different, they are asserted to be the result and the cause.

original: de ltar gyur na 'di mi 'dod par 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes ston pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: de ltar gyur na 'di mi 'dod par 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes ston pa gsungs pa /
translated: If that were the case, this would occur without being desired.

original: snying stobs la sogs pa rnams kyi zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: snying stobs la sogs pa rnams kyi zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: The argument is as follows:

original: gang sgra gcig las tha mi dad pa'i rang bzhin de ni tha mi dad pa yin te /
analyzed: gang sgra gcig las tha mi dad pa'i rang bzhin de ni tha mi dad pa yin te /
translated: That which is not different from a single sound is not different.

original: sgra'i rang gi ngo bo bzhin snying stobs la sogs pa rnams kyang de lta bu'o //
analyzed: sgra'i rang gi ngo bo bzhin snying stobs la sogs pa rnams kyang de lta bu'o //
translated: Like the nature of sound, sattva and so on are also like that.

original: gang snying stobs la sogs pa gcig min las tha mi dad pa'i rang bzhin de gcig min yin te /
analyzed: gang snying stobs la sogs pa gcig min las tha mi dad pa'i rang bzhin de gcig min yin te /
translated: That which is not different from many is not many.

original: bde ba la sogs pa bzhin sgra yang de lta bu'o zhes ba rang bzhin gyi thal 'gyur dag go //
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa bzhin sgra yang de lta bu'o zhes ba rang bzhin gyi thal 'gyur dag go //
translated: Like pleasure and so on, sound is also like that.

original: de las bzlog pas ni /
analyzed: de las bzlog pas ni /
translated: The reverse of that is:

original: gang gcig min de ni sgra gcig las tha mi dad pa'i rang bzhin ma yin te /
analyzed: gang gcig min de ni sgra gcig las tha mi dad pa'i rang bzhin ma yin te /
translated: That which is not many is not of a nature that is not different from a single sound.

original: dper na skyes bu mang po rnams bzhin /
analyzed: dper na skyes bu mang po rnams bzhin /
translated: For example, like many men.

original: snying stobs la sogs pa yang de lta bu'o //
analyzed: snying stobs la sogs pa yang de lta bu'o //
translated: Sattva and so on are also like that.

original: gang gcig yin pa de snying stobs la sogs pa rnams las tha dad med pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gang gcig yin pa de snying stobs la sogs pa rnams las tha dad med pa ma yin te /
translated: That which is one is not of a nature that is not different from sattva and so on.

original: dper na sems pa can gyi gsal ba gcig pu bzhin /
analyzed: dper na sems pa can gyi gsal ba gcig pu bzhin /
translated: For example, like a single conscious being.

original: sgra yang de lta bu'o zhes pa khyab byed 'gal ba dag go //
analyzed: sgra yang de lta bu'o zhes pa khyab byed 'gal ba dag go //
translated: Sound is also like that.

original: de las kyang khas blangs pa nyams so //
analyzed: de las kyang khas blangs pa nyams so //
translated: And in that case, your own position is undermined.

original: 'am zhes pa'i sgra ni rnam par brtag pa'i don can no zhes pa 'bras byed min pa'am zhes pa 'dir 'am gyi sgra gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'am zhes pa'i sgra ni rnam par brtag pa'i don can no zhes pa 'bras byed min pa'am zhes pa 'dir 'am gyi sgra gang yin pa'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúor‚Äù has the sense of a choice.

original: gzhan nyid yin na'ang gzung bya min //
analyzed: gzhan nyid yin na'ang gzung bya min //
translated: Even if they are different, they are not apprehended.

original: zhes pas ma nges pa gsungs so //üîΩde'i rdul phra rab ces pa sgra'i rdul phra rab bo //
analyzed: zhes pas ma nges pa gsungs so // de'i rdul phra rab ces pa sgra'i rdul phra rab bo //
translated: Thus he states the uncertainty.üîΩ‚ÄúIts atom‚Äù is the atom of sound.

original: de tsam la sogs pa'am zhes pa sgra de tsam la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de tsam la sogs pa'am zhes pa sgra de tsam la sogs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThat much, etc.‚Äù is that much sound, etc.

original: sogs pa'i sgras nga rgyal dang chen po dang gtso bo gzung bar bya'o //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras nga rgyal dang chen po dang gtso bo gzung bar bya'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúetc.‚Äù includes the great one and the principal.

original: ma yin zhes pa la sogs pas kyang ma nges pa gsungs so //
analyzed: ma yin zhes pa la sogs pas kyang ma nges pa gsungs so //
translated: ‚ÄúNot‚Äù and so on also states the uncertainty.

original: gang gi phyir 'bras bu nyid dang rgyu nyid la sogs pa rnams dbang po'i yul las tha dad pa ma yin zhing /
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'bras bu nyid dang rgyu nyid la sogs pa rnams dbang po'i yul las tha dad pa ma yin zhing /
translated: Because the effects, causes, and so on are not different from the objects of the senses,

original: dbang po'i blos rtogs pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: dbang po'i blos rtogs pa yang ma yin no //
translated: and they are not realized by the mind of the senses.

original: thams cad sna tshogs rnam can 'gyur ro zhes pa ste /
analyzed: thams cad sna tshogs rnam can 'gyur ro zhes pa ste /
translated: Everything would be of a variegated nature.

original: gang sna tshogs kyi rnam par mi 'dod pa de yang ste snying stobs la sogs pa tshogs pa ni tha mi dad pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: gang sna tshogs kyi rnam par mi 'dod pa de yang ste snying stobs la sogs pa tshogs pa ni tha mi dad pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: And that which does not admit of a variegated form, that is, the collection of sattva, etc., is not different.

original: tha dad pa la zhes pa la sogs pas bsgrub bar bya ba med na gtan tshigs med pa gsungs so //üîΩde'i @66a * //
analyzed: tha dad pa la zhes pa la sogs pas bsgrub bar bya ba med na gtan tshigs med pa gsungs so // de'i @66a * //
translated: If there is no probandum, there is no probans. This is stated in the words ‚ÄúIf there is no difference, etc.‚Äù

original: dbang gis zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: dbang gis zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: By the power of that, etc.

original: gang gi rnam par yul la shes pa skye ba de'i rnam pas yul de rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: gang gi rnam par yul la shes pa skye ba de'i rnam pas yul de rtogs par bya'o //
translated: The object is to be understood by the form of that in which the cognition arises with regard to the object.

original: mthong ngo zhes pa la sogs pas gtan tshigs gsungs so //
analyzed: mthong ngo zhes pa la sogs pas gtan tshigs gsungs so //
translated: ‚ÄúIt is seen, etc.‚Äù states the probans.

original: gang rnam pa tha mi dad pa 'dzin par byed pa de sna tshogs pa'i yul can ma yin te /
analyzed: gang rnam pa tha mi dad pa 'dzin par byed pa de sna tshogs pa'i yul can ma yin te /
translated: That which apprehends without difference of form is not of a variegated nature,

original: sems pa can 'dzin pa bzhin /
analyzed: sems pa can 'dzin pa bzhin /
translated: like the apprehender of the sentient being.

original: sgra la sogs pa 'dzin pa yang de lta bu'o zhes pa khyab byed dang 'gal ba'o //
analyzed: sgra la sogs pa 'dzin pa yang de lta bu'o zhes pa khyab byed dang 'gal ba'o //
translated: The apprehension of sound, etc., is like that. This is a contradiction of the pervasion.

original: yul gzhan la zhes pa dbang po gzhan gyi yul nyid du mngon par 'dod pa la'o //
analyzed: yul gzhan la zhes pa dbang po gzhan gyi yul nyid du mngon par 'dod pa la'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIn another object‚Äù means in the object of another sense faculty.

original: 'o na yang zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: 'o na yang zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúBut still‚Äù and so on.

original: thams cad la bde ba la sogs pa'i rigs tha mi dad na yang dbang po gcig nyid du thal ba ma yin te /
analyzed: thams cad la bde ba la sogs pa'i rigs tha mi dad na yang dbang po gcig nyid du thal ba ma yin te /
translated: Even though there is no difference in the class of pleasure and so on, it is not the case that there is only one sense faculty.

original: gang gi phyir dbyibs kyis khyad par du byas pa'i bde ba la sogs pa rnams 'dzin par byed cing /
analyzed: gang gi phyir dbyibs kyis khyad par du byas pa'i bde ba la sogs pa rnams 'dzin par byed cing /
translated: Because it apprehends pleasure and so on qualified by shape.

original: dbyibs de yang yul gzhan la med do //
analyzed: dbyibs de yang yul gzhan la med do //
translated: And that shape does not exist in another object.

original: dbyibs du ma'i dbye bas zhes pa sngon po dang ser po la sogs pa'i dbyibs kyi khyad par gyis so //
analyzed: dbyibs du ma'i dbye bas zhes pa sngon po dang ser po la sogs pa'i dbyibs kyi khyad par gyis so //
translated: By the division of many shapes, by the difference of the shape of blue, yellow, and so on.

original: dbyibs gcig rjes su 'jug pa mthong ba ma yin no zhes pa ste /
analyzed: dbyibs gcig rjes su 'jug pa mthong ba ma yin no zhes pa ste /

analyzed: 'dis ni rjes su 'jug pa dang ldan pa'i dbyibs gcig med pa tha snyad kyi ched du rang bzhin mi dmigs pa gsungs so //
translated: This states that the non-observation of nature is for the purpose of convention, where there is no single shape that is present.

original: de kho na zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de kho na zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúThat very‚Äù and so on.

original: gang gi phyir dbyibs kyi tha dad las dbang po tha dad pa'i gzung bya nyid du sgra dang reg bya la sogs pa'i rigs rnams 'dod na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir dbyibs kyi tha dad las dbang po tha dad pa'i gzung bya nyid du sgra dang reg bya la sogs pa'i rigs rnams 'dod na /
translated: Because you assert that sound, tactility, and so on are different types of objects that are apprehended by different sense faculties due to their different shapes.

original: gzugs kyi rigs gcig kho na la yang dbyibs du mar 'dod de /
analyzed: gzugs kyi rigs gcig kho na la yang dbyibs du mar 'dod de /
translated: But you also assert that a single type of form, such as a line, has many shapes.

original: de'i phyir dbang po mtha' yas pa nyid de kho nar thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i phyir dbang po mtha' yas pa nyid de kho nar thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, it follows that there would be an infinite number of sense faculties,

original: sgra'i mtshan nyid rnams las ma yin pa kho na'o zhes pa'o //
analyzed: sgra'i mtshan nyid rnams las ma yin pa kho na'o zhes pa'o //
translated: because sound and so on would not have the characteristics of sound and so on.

original: ser skya pa snga ma rnams ni thams cad du bde ba la sogs pa rnams ngo bo gcig pa kho na ste /
analyzed: ser skya pa snga ma rnams ni thams cad du bde ba la sogs pa rnams ngo bo gcig pa kho na ste /
translated: The earlier followers of Kapila assert that pleasure and so on are all of one nature.

original: ma dhu pa ni /
analyzed: ma dhu pa ni /
translated: Madhu

original: thams cad du de rnams tha dad par 'dod do //üîΩbde ba la sogs pa gang rnams sgra'i bdag nyid du yongs su 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: thams cad du de rnams tha dad par 'dod do // bde ba la sogs pa gang rnams sgra'i bdag nyid du yongs su 'gyur gyi /
translated: asserts that they are all different.

original: reg bya la sogs pa'i bdag nyid du ni ma yin pa de rnams sgra'i mtshan nyid gsum mo zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: reg bya la sogs pa'i bdag nyid du ni ma yin pa de rnams sgra'i mtshan nyid gsum mo zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: We should say that those that transform into the nature of sound and so on, but not into the nature of tactility and so on, are the three characteristics of sound.

original: de bzhin du gang rnams reg bya'i bdag nyid kho nar yongs su 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: de bzhin du gang rnams reg bya'i bdag nyid kho nar yongs su 'gyur gyi /
translated: Similarly, those that are only of the nature of the tangible

original: don gzhan gyi bdag nyid du ni ma yin pa de rnams reg bya'i mtshan nyid gsum mo zhes pa ste /
analyzed: don gzhan gyi bdag nyid du ni ma yin pa de rnams reg bya'i mtshan nyid gsum mo zhes pa ste /
translated: are the three characteristics of the tangible.

original: de bzhin du gzhan la'ang shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzhan la'ang shes par bya'o //
translated: The same should be understood for the others.

original: 'o na gsum rnams kyi tshogs pa ni gsum ma yin nam de la gcig gi tshig gis @66b 'byung bar 'os te /
analyzed: 'o na gsum rnams kyi tshogs pa ni gsum ma yin nam de la gcig gi tshig gis @66b 'byung bar 'os te /
translated: But isn‚Äôt the collection of the three not three? It is suitable to speak of one in that collection.

original: des na gsum po rnams las shes pa ci ltar zhe na /
analyzed: des na gsum po rnams las shes pa ci ltar zhe na /
translated: So how can there be consciousness from the three?

original: skyon 'di med de /
analyzed: skyon 'di med de /
translated: This error does not exist.

original: sgra so so la gsum po gzhan dang gzhan yin zhing /
analyzed: sgra so so la gsum po gzhan dang gzhan yin zhing /
translated: Each sound is different from the other three.

original: de'i phyir na gsum po rnams mang po nyid kyi phyir mang po'i tshig go //
analyzed: de'i phyir na gsum po rnams mang po nyid kyi phyir mang po'i tshig go //
translated: Therefore, because the three are many, there is the word ‚Äúmany.‚Äù

original: gzhan rnams ni rnam pa gzhan du gsum rnams rnam par 'chad par byed do//
analyzed: gzhan rnams ni rnam pa gzhan du gsum rnams rnam par 'chad par byed do//
translated: Others explain the three in a different way.

original: sgra'i rdul phra rab gcig kho na gsum po ste /
analyzed: sgra'i rdul phra rab gcig kho na gsum po ste /
translated: Only one atom of sound is the three,

original: rdzas gsum gyi bdag nyid yin te /
analyzed: rdzas gsum gyi bdag nyid yin te /
translated: because it is of the nature of the three substances.

original: bde ba la sogs pa rnams gcig nyid du gong bur gyur pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa rnams gcig nyid du gong bur gyur pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because pleasure, etc. are one and the same in the aggregate.

original: sgra'i rdul phra rab thams cad ni 'di lta bu rnams so //
analyzed: sgra'i rdul phra rab thams cad ni 'di lta bu rnams so //
translated: All the subtle atoms of sound are like this.

original: de bzhin du reg bya la sogs pa'i rdul phra rab rnams dang dbang po'i rdul phra rab rnams kyang rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du reg bya la sogs pa'i rdul phra rab rnams dang dbang po'i rdul phra rab rnams kyang rig par bya'o //
translated: In the same way, the subtle atoms of touch, etc. and the subtle atoms of the sense faculties should be understood.

original: de rnams kho na bsags pa rnams ni /
analyzed: de rnams kho na bsags pa rnams ni /

translated: It is also tenable that the suffix ‚Äúanu‚Äù merely indicates assistance.

original: 'di skad bshad par 'gyur te /üîΩji ltar dbang pos phan 'dogs pa la ltos pa'i yid kyi phyi rol gyi don la rab tu 'jug pa de ltar yid kyis phan 'dogs pa la ltos pa'i dbang po yang ngo zhes smra ba de'i yang 'di mngon sum du dmigs pa ma yin pa'i don mthong
analyzed: 'di skad bshad par 'gyur te / ji ltar dbang pos phan 'dogs pa la ltos pa'i yid kyi phyi rol gyi don la rab tu 'jug pa de ltar yid kyis phan 'dogs pa la ltos pa'i dbang po yang ngo zhes smra ba de'i yang 'di mngon sum du dmigs pa ma yin pa'i don mthong
translated: This is explained as follows:
Just as the mind engages external objects in dependence on the assistance of the sense faculties, so too the sense faculties engage objects in dependence on the assistance of the mind.

original: 'grub pa ma yin no zhes pa 'di kho nas bsal lo //
analyzed: 'grub pa ma yin no zhes pa 'di kho nas bsal lo //
translated: The opponent‚Äôs view that the mind sees objects that are not directly perceived is refuted by this alone.

original: de'i phyir phan tshun yang dag par rig bar byed pa kho na 'dir ston te /
analyzed: de'i phyir phan tshun yang dag par rig bar byed pa kho na 'dir ston te /
translated: Therefore it is taught here that the sense faculties and the mind are mutually informing.

original: de kho na yang phan 'dogs pa'o //
analyzed: de kho na yang phan 'dogs pa'o //
translated: That is the assistance.

original: rjes su sgra don med pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: rjes su sgra don med pa yang ma yin te /
translated: It is not the case that the meaning of the word is absent later on,

original: bar ma chod pa'i don can nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: bar ma chod pa'i don can nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because it has the meaning of an uninterrupted continuum.

original: nyes pa 'di ni med de zhes pa /
analyzed: nyes pa 'di ni med de zhes pa /
translated: This fault does not exist,

original: 'jug pa yang dag par rig pa 'di tshad mar 'dod pa ma yin pa kho na ste /
analyzed: 'jug pa yang dag par rig pa 'di tshad mar 'dod pa ma yin pa kho na ste /
translated: because this engagement, which is the correct understanding, is not asserted to be valid knowledge,

original: de ni dran pa yin pas so //
analyzed: de ni dran pa yin pas so //
translated: because it is memory.

original: ji ltar 'dod pa dang kho ro ba dang zhe sdang dang 'jigs pa la sogs pa rnams dran pa de bzhin du dbang po'i 'jug pa rnams dang yid kyi 'jug pa yang yid kyis so //
analyzed: ji ltar 'dod pa dang kho ro ba dang zhe sdang dang 'jigs pa la sogs pa rnams dran pa de bzhin du dbang po'i 'jug pa rnams dang yid kyi 'jug pa yang yid kyis so //
translated: Just as desire, anger, and fear, etc. are remembered, so too the engagement of the sense faculties and the engagement of the mind are remembered by the mind.

original: gzhung yang 'di ltar drang bar bya ste /
analyzed: gzhung yang 'di ltar drang bar bya ste /
translated: The text should be interpreted as follows:

original: phyi rol gyi don rnams la dbang po zhen par byed pa ma ngon sum gyi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi don rnams la dbang po zhen par byed pa ma ngon sum gyi mtshan nyid do //
translated: The definition of direct perception is that which causes the sense faculties to engage with external objects.

original: dbang pos zhen pa de la ni yid rjes su zhen par byed do zhes pa de ma thag pa'i dran pa'o //
analyzed: dbang pos zhen pa de la ni yid rjes su zhen par byed do zhes pa de ma thag pa'i dran pa'o //
translated: That which causes the mind to engage with what is engaged with by the sense faculties is the memory of the immediately preceding condition.

original: ji ltar yang dbang pos zhen pa la yid rjes su zhen par byed pa de ma thag par brjod pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: ji ltar yang dbang pos zhen pa la yid rjes su zhen par byed pa de ma thag par brjod pa de bzhin du /
translated: Just as the engagement of the sense faculties causes the mind to engage with what is engaged with by the sense faculties, the immediately preceding condition is described.

original: yid kyi zhen pa ni dbang po yang dag par rig par byed cing /
analyzed: yid kyi zhen pa ni dbang po yang dag par rig par byed cing /
translated: Mental clinging causes the sense organ to perceive correctly.üîΩ

original: dran par byed do zhes pa'i don te /
analyzed: dran par byed do zhes pa'i don te /
translated: Mental adherence is the faculty that makes one understand and remember.üîΩThis is the meaning of the above passage.

original: dbyings rnams ni du ma'i don can nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: dbyings rnams ni du ma'i don can nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because the dhƒÅtus have the meaning of many.

original: ni tsa gnyis pa yang rgyu dang ldan pa nyid can du 'dir rig par bya'o //
analyzed: ni tsa gnyis pa yang rgyu dang ldan pa nyid can du 'dir rig par bya'o //
translated: The second ca is to be known here as having the meaning of having a cause.

original: dbang po ni dran pa'i rjes su mthun pa yid la phan 'dogs par byed cing de la rab tu sbyor ba lta bu'o zhes pa'o //
analyzed: dbang po ni dran pa'i rjes su mthun pa yid la phan 'dogs par byed cing de la rab tu sbyor ba lta bu'o zhes pa'o //
translated: The faculty is like that which is favorable to memory, which benefits the mind, and which is applied to it.

original: dran pa kho nas 'jug pa yul du byed pa la don mthong ba 'grub bo snyam du sems te /
analyzed: dran pa kho nas 'jug pa yul du byed pa la don mthong ba 'grub bo snyam du sems te /
translated: One thinks that the seeing of the object is established by the engagement that is made into an object by memory alone.

original: de lta na 'jug pa 'dzin pa ni tshad pa ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir mtshang ba nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta na 'jug pa 'dzin pa ni tshad pa ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir mtshang ba nyid ma yin no //
translated: Thus, there is no fault because the engagement that is apprehended is not valid cognition.

original: ji skad skad bshad pa zhes pa 'jug pa yang dag par rig pa dran pa nyid yin pa la shes par byed pa gsungs so //
analyzed: ji skad skad bshad pa zhes pa 'jug pa yang dag par rig pa dran pa nyid yin pa la shes par byed pa gsungs so //
translated: As it was said, it is taught that the engagement that is understood is memory itself.

original: dran pa ni mngon sum gyi zhen pa'i khyad par ro zhes pa /
analyzed: dran pa ni mngon sum gyi zhen pa'i khyad par ro zhes pa /
translated: Memory is the adherence of perception.

original: khyad par gyi sgras so sor mngon par sbrel bar bya'o //
analyzed: khyad par gyi sgras so sor mngon par sbrel bar bya'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúespecially‚Äù should be connected with each one.

original: 'o na gzhung 'di'i bstan bcos su nye bar bkod pa don gzhan can ma yin nam /
analyzed: 'o na gzhung 'di'i bstan bcos su nye bar bkod pa don gzhan can ma yin nam /
translated: But isn‚Äôt the treatise set forth in this text for another purpose?

original: de ci'i phyir 'dis dran pa nyid du shes par bya /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir 'dis dran pa nyid du shes par bya /
translated: Why should it be known as ‚ÄúMemory?‚Äù

original: de ltar ni ci dbang po dang yid dag kho na lhan cig kho nang phyi rol gyi don rnams la zhen par byed dam /
analyzed: de ltar ni ci dbang po dang yid dag kho na lhan cig kho nang phyi rol gyi don rnams la zhen par byed dam /
translated: In this way, do only the senses and the mind apprehend external objects, or do they not apprehend them?

original: 'on te lhan cig byed pa ma yin pa kho na zhes dogs pa la /
analyzed: 'on te lhan cig byed pa ma yin pa kho na zhes dogs pa la /
translated: Fearing that this is not understood,

original: 'di bshad de /
analyzed: 'di bshad de /
translated: he explains this.

original: phyi rol gyi don rnams la dbang po zhen par byed la /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi don rnams la dbang po zhen par byed la /
translated: The senses apprehend external objects.

original: dbang pos zhen pa de la ni yid rjes su zhen par byed do //
analyzed: dbang pos zhen pa de la ni yid rjes su zhen par byed do //
translated: The mind follows what is apprehended by the senses.

original: ci'i phyir na dran @70b ba mngon sum gyi zhen pa'i khyad par 'di yod pas so zhes pa'o //
analyzed: ci'i phyir na dran @70b ba mngon sum gyi zhen pa'i khyad par 'di yod pas so zhes pa'o //
translated: Why? Because there is this distinction in the apprehension of memory and direct perception.

original: 'di ltar brjod par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di ltar brjod par 'gyur te /
translated: This is what is said.

original: dran pa mngon sum gyi zhen pa'i bye brag yod de /
analyzed: dran pa mngon sum gyi zhen pa'i bye brag yod de /
translated: There is a distinction in the apprehension of memory and direct perception.

original: 'di ni shin tu rab tu grags pa yin pas bsnyon par mi nus so //
analyzed: 'di ni shin tu rab tu grags pa yin pas bsnyon par mi nus so //
translated: Since this is very well known, it cannot be denied.

original: gnyis ka dag gi phyi rol gyi don la 'jug pa na 'di rigs pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: gnyis ka dag gi phyi rol gyi don la 'jug pa na 'di rigs pa yang ma yin te /
translated: It is also illogical for both to engage external objects.

original: gang phyir gal te phyi rol gyi don la yid 'jug cing dbang po'i 'jug pa rnams la ma yin pa de'i tshe de rnams yid kyi 'jug ba rnams kyis byin gyis ma brlabs pa dang / zhen par byas pa ma yin pa rnams dang / skyes bu las byung ba sems pa can dang yang dag par 'dus pa ma yin pa dang /
analyzed: gang phyir gal te phyi rol gyi don la yid 'jug cing dbang po'i 'jug pa rnams la ma yin pa de'i tshe de rnams yid kyi 'jug ba rnams kyis byin gyis ma brlabs pa dang / zhen par byas pa ma yin pa rnams dang / skyes bu las byung ba sems pa can dang yang dag par 'dus pa ma yin pa dang /
translated: If the mind engages external objects and not the engagement of the sense faculties, then the sense faculties would not be empowered by the engagement of the mind, they would not be objects of attachment, they would not be produced from the mind, they would not be associated with the mind,

original: rkyen med pa rnams su 'gyur la /
analyzed: rkyen med pa rnams su 'gyur la /
translated: and they would be without conditions.

original: de las kyang ci ltar mngon sum tshad mar brjod /
analyzed: de las kyang ci ltar mngon sum tshad mar brjod /
translated: How could they be called direct valid knowledge?

original: rkyen med pa'i 'jug pa rnams ni mngon sum tshad mar 'gyur ba ma yin pas so //
analyzed: rkyen med pa'i 'jug pa rnams ni mngon sum tshad mar 'gyur ba ma yin pas so //
translated: Because engagement that is without conditions is not direct valid knowledge.

original: mngon sum med pa'i phyir yang dran pa de yang de sngon ma can du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mngon sum med pa'i phyir yang dran pa de yang de sngon ma can du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: And because direct perception does not exist, memory would not have that as its cause.

original: gang gi tshe dbang po'i zhen pa la yid kyis rjes su zhen par byed pa de'i tshe dran pa mngon sum gyi zhen pa'i bye brag tu 'thad de /
analyzed: gang gi tshe dbang po'i zhen pa la yid kyis rjes su zhen par byed pa de'i tshe dran pa mngon sum gyi zhen pa'i bye brag tu 'thad de /
translated: When the mind subsequently conceives the object conceived by the sense faculty, then it is tenable that memory is a specific instance of direct perception.

original: de ltar ni da ltar ba'i dus na phyi rol gyi don rnams la dbang po'i zhen pa zhugs pa ni rjes su nges par zhen par byed cing /üîΩyid la dbang po'i zhen pa ni rang gi yul du snang ba dang yid kyi zhen pa dang yang dag par 'dus pa ste /
analyzed: de ltar ni da ltar ba'i dus na phyi rol gyi don rnams la dbang po'i zhen pa zhugs pa ni rjes su nges par zhen par byed cing / yid la dbang po'i zhen pa ni rang gi yul du snang ba dang yid kyi zhen pa dang yang dag par 'dus pa ste /
translated: In this way, when external objects are present, the sense faculty conceives them, and the mind subsequently conceives them.üîΩThe mind conceives the object that appears to the sense faculty and is united with the conception of the sense faculty.

original: skyes bu can gyi rkyen gyis rkyen dang bcas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skyes bu can gyi rkyen gyis rkyen dang bcas par 'gyur ro //
translated: The mind is a condition of memory because it is a condition of the sense faculty.

original: de ltar dbang po de ni mngon sum gyi zhen par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar dbang po de ni mngon sum gyi zhen par 'gyur te /
translated: In this way, the sense faculty becomes the conception of direct perception.

original: dbang po'i zhen pa de mngon sum nyid du 'gyur ro zhes pa'i don te /
analyzed: dbang po'i zhen pa de mngon sum nyid du 'gyur ro zhes pa'i don te /
translated: The meaning of this is that the conception of the sense faculty becomes direct perception.

original: 'ba' zhig pa'i ni mngon sum gyi zhen pa las phyis yid kyi dran pa'i zhen par 'gyur ro zhes pa'o //
analyzed: 'ba' zhig pa'i ni mngon sum gyi zhen pa las phyis yid kyi dran pa'i zhen par 'gyur ro zhes pa'o //
translated: The conception of the mind is memory that occurs after the conception of direct perception.

original: de skad du yang bshad pa /
analyzed: de skad du yang bshad pa /
translated: This is also explained in the following.

original: 'ba' zhig pa ni 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i dus dag la 'jug go zhes pa'o //
analyzed: 'ba' zhig pa ni 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i dus dag la 'jug go zhes pa'o //
translated: The ‚Äúsolitary‚Äù is engaged in the past and future times.

original: 'on dbang po'i zhen pa dang lhan cig par phyi rol gyi don la yang 'jug pa'i yid ni da ltar gyi dus su mngon sum gyi zhen par 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: 'on dbang po'i zhen pa dang lhan cig par phyi rol gyi don la yang 'jug pa'i yid ni da ltar gyi dus su mngon sum gyi zhen par 'gyur zhing /
translated: But the mind that is engaged in the external object together with the attachment of the sense faculty is the attachment of the present time.

original: 'ba' zhig pa'i ni phyis dran pa'i shes par ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: 'ba' zhig pa'i ni phyis dran pa'i shes par ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: And the ‚Äúsolitary‚Äù is not the memory of the subsequent cognition, is it?

original: 'di yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di yod pa ma yin te /
translated: This is not so.

original: de ltar phyi rol gyi don 'dzin par gyur na /
analyzed: de ltar phyi rol gyi don 'dzin par gyur na /
translated: If it were to apprehend the external object in that way,

original: gnyis ka dag kyang don gcig byed pa nyid kyi phyir dbang po rnams don med pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gnyis ka dag kyang don gcig byed pa nyid kyi phyir dbang po rnams don med pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: then both would be the same in their function, and the sense faculties would be meaningless.

original: de ltar ni bshad pa /üîΩdon gcig khyed pa'i dbang po dag rtog pa na /
analyzed: de ltar ni bshad pa / don gcig khyed pa'i dbang po dag rtog pa na /
translated: This is explained as follows:

original: nus pa nyid ma yin no zhes so //
analyzed: nus pa nyid ma yin no zhes so //
translated: ‚ÄúThe sense faculties, which have the same object, are not capable of apprehending it when they are imagined to be separate.‚Äù

original: gang gi phyir de ltar dran @71a * //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar dran @71a * //
translated: Because of that, the memory is not the attachment of the direct perception.

original: pa mngon sum gyis zhen pa'i bye brag phyi rol gyi don la 'jug na /
analyzed: pa mngon sum gyis zhen pa'i bye brag phyi rol gyi don la 'jug na /
translated: If the mind is engaged in the external object, which is the particular attachment of the direct perception,

original: yid kyis 'thad pa ma yin pa /
analyzed: yid kyis 'thad pa ma yin pa /
translated: then it is not tenable.

original: de'i phyir dbang po'i zhen pa de la ni yid kyis rjes su zhen par byed kyi phyi rol gyi don rnams la ni ma yin no zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir dbang po'i zhen pa de la ni yid kyis rjes su zhen par byed kyi phyi rol gyi don rnams la ni ma yin no zhes pa'o //
translated: Therefore, the mind is attached to the attachment of the sense faculties, and not to external objects.

original: de 'di ltar dbang po dang yid dag gis lhan cig phyi rol gyi don rnams la 'jug par byed pa ma yin no zhes pa'i don 'di bsgrub pa'i ched du /
analyzed: de 'di ltar dbang po dang yid dag gis lhan cig phyi rol gyi don rnams la 'jug par byed pa ma yin no zhes pa'i don 'di bsgrub pa'i ched du /
translated: In order to establish the meaning that the mind does not engage in external objects together with the sense faculties,

original: 'di yod do zhes pa la sogs pa'i gzhung nye bar bkod kyi /
analyzed: 'di yod do zhes pa la sogs pa'i gzhung nye bar bkod kyi /
translated: the passage ‚Äúthis exists‚Äù and so on is presented.

original: 'jug pa yang dag par rig pa dran pa nyid du bsgrub pa'i ched du ni ma yin na /
analyzed: 'jug pa yang dag par rig pa dran pa nyid du bsgrub pa'i ched du ni ma yin na /
translated: It is not for the purpose of establishing the mere awareness of engagement as memory.

original: de ci ltar de dran pa nyid du shes par byed pa nyid du brjod ces pa'o //
analyzed: de ci ltar de dran pa nyid du shes par byed pa nyid du brjod ces pa'o //
translated: How then is it said to be the very cause of its being memory?

original: 'jug pa yang dag par rig pa 'di grangs can pa'i dran pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: 'jug pa yang dag par rig pa 'di grangs can pa'i dran pa yang ma yin te /
translated: This awareness of engagement is not the memory of the SƒÅ·πÉkhya,

original: nyams su myong ba sngon ma can zhes pa ni dran par mngon par 'dod la /
analyzed: nyams su myong ba sngon ma can zhes pa ni dran par mngon par 'dod la /
translated: because it is asserted that memory is that which has a prior experience.

original: 'jug pa yang dag par rig pa 'di ni sngar med pa kho na nyams su myong ba yin no //
analyzed: 'jug pa yang dag par rig pa 'di ni sngar med pa kho na nyams su myong ba yin no //
translated: This awareness of engagement is only an experience that did not exist previously.

original: de ci ltar pha rol gyi bsam pas dran pa ni de'i 'jug pa yang dag par rig ba'o zhes brjod ce na /
analyzed: de ci ltar pha rol gyi bsam pas dran pa ni de'i 'jug pa yang dag par rig ba'o zhes brjod ce na /
translated: How can it be said that the recollection of another's thought is the knowledge of his engagement?

original: pha rol po la rtog pa gzhan med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: pha rol po la rtog pa gzhan med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no other thought in the other.

original: de ltar ni 'jug pa nye bar dmigs pa re zhig nges par khas blang bar bya ste /
analyzed: de ltar ni 'jug pa nye bar dmigs pa re zhig nges par khas blang bar bya ste /
translated: Thus, the engagement must be admitted to be perceived.

original: gzhan du na de nye bar ma dmigs na /
analyzed: gzhan du na de nye bar ma dmigs na /
translated: Otherwise, if it is not perceived,

original: don nye bar dmigs par yang mi 'gyur ro zhes 'gro ba long ba dang lkugs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: don nye bar dmigs par yang mi 'gyur ro zhes 'gro ba long ba dang lkugs par 'gyur ro //
translated: then the object is not perceived, and the world would be blind and dumb.

original: 'jug pa yang dag par rig pa mngon sum la sogs pa rnams kyi nang du 'du ba yang ma yin no //
analyzed: 'jug pa yang dag par rig pa mngon sum la sogs pa rnams kyi nang du 'du ba yang ma yin no //
translated: And the knowledge of engagement is not included among the direct perceptions, etc.üîΩTherefore, because there is no other cognition, this is a false answer.

original: de'i phyir rtogs pa gzhan med pa'i phyir 'di yang lan yang dag pa ma yin pa smra ba'o zhes dogs par byas nas de skad du bshad do //üîΩdbang po'i 'jug pa la ni bar mchod pa'i zhes ba ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir rtogs pa gzhan med pa'i phyir 'di yang lan yang dag pa ma yin pa smra ba'o zhes dogs par byas nas de skad du bshad do // dbang po'i 'jug pa la ni bar mchod pa'i zhes ba ste /
translated: The answer to that is: The engagement of the sense faculties is not in between.

original: dbang po'i 'jug pa smos pas yid kyi 'jug pa yang gzung bar bya'o //
analyzed: dbang po'i 'jug pa smos pas yid kyi 'jug pa yang gzung bar bya'o //
translated: The mention of the engagement of the sense faculties includes the engagement of the mental faculty.

original: dran min nyams su ma myong phyir //
analyzed: dran min nyams su ma myong phyir //
translated: Because it is not experienced as memory or non-memory.

original: zhes pa la sogs pas /
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pas /
translated: And so on.

original: gang nyams su myong ba ma yin pa de la dran pa'i rtogs par 'gyur ba ma yin te /
analyzed: gang nyams su myong ba ma yin pa de la dran pa'i rtogs par 'gyur ba ma yin te /
translated: That which is not experienced is not remembered.

original: dper na rgyud gzhan gyi nyams su ma myong ba'i 'dod pa la sogs pa rnams la bzhin /
analyzed: dper na rgyud gzhan gyi nyams su ma myong ba'i 'dod pa la sogs pa rnams la bzhin /
translated: For example, it is like the desire realm and so on that are not experienced in other mindstreams.

original: dbang po'i 'jug pa rnams kyang nyams su myong ba ma yin no zhes rgyud dang 'gal ba gsungs so //
analyzed: dbang po'i 'jug pa rnams kyang nyams su myong ba ma yin no zhes rgyud dang 'gal ba gsungs so //
translated: The engagement of the sense faculties is also not experienced. Thus he states the contradiction with the treatise.

original: cig car gnyis zhes pa la sogs pa gal te dran pa nyid rab tu bsgrub pa'i ched du gtan tshigs ma grub pa nyid du 'dod na /
analyzed: cig car gnyis zhes pa la sogs pa gal te dran pa nyid rab tu bsgrub pa'i ched du gtan tshigs ma grub pa nyid du 'dod na /
translated: If you assert that the reason is not established in order to fully establish memory itself,

original: de lta na lhan cig 'byung ba'i dbang po dang yid kyi @71b zhen pa dag gis phan tshun yang dag par rig par byed pa na /
analyzed: de lta na lhan cig 'byung ba'i dbang po dang yid kyi @71b zhen pa dag gis phan tshun yang dag par rig par byed pa na /
translated: then when the simultaneously arisen sense faculty and mental cognition mutually cognize each other,

original: 'jug pa de rnams la dran pa'i rtog pa bar ma chad par yang dag par 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'jug pa de rnams la dran pa'i rtog pa bar ma chad par yang dag par 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: the conception of memory would arise uninterruptedly in those engagements.

original: de lta na yang zhes pa yul dbang po'i zhen ba gzung bar bya ba yin te /
analyzed: de lta na yang zhes pa yul dbang po'i zhen ba gzung bar bya ba yin te /
translated: ‚ÄúEven so‚Äù refers to the object, which is the object of the clinging of the sense faculties.

original: yul can 'dzin par byed ba po yid kyi zhen pa'i'o //
analyzed: yul can 'dzin par byed ba po yid kyi zhen pa'i'o //
translated: The clinging of the mind is the subject that apprehends.

original: yid kyi zhen pa yang yul can 'dzin par byed pa po dbang po'i zhen pa'i yul gzung bar bya ste /
analyzed: yid kyi zhen pa yang yul can 'dzin par byed pa po dbang po'i zhen pa'i yul gzung bar bya ste /
translated: The clinging of the mind is the object of the clinging of the sense faculties, which is the subject that apprehends.

original: phan tshun yang dag par rig par byed na ni /üîΩde dag ltos pas yul can nyid dang yul nyid du yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phan tshun yang dag par rig par byed na ni / de dag ltos pas yul can nyid dang yul nyid du yang 'gyur ro //
translated: If they were to mutually cognize each other,üîΩthen they would be the subject and object in dependence on each other.

original: de dag phan tshun rgyu mtshan dang rgyu mtshan las byung bar 'dod par bya ba ste /
analyzed: de dag phan tshun rgyu mtshan dang rgyu mtshan las byung bar 'dod par bya ba ste /
translated: They should be asserted to be the reason and the one arisen from the reason.

original: gzhan du na yul dang yul can nyid srid pa ma yin pas so //
analyzed: gzhan du na yul dang yul can nyid srid pa ma yin pas so //
translated: Otherwise, it is not possible for there to be a subject and object.

original: cig car skyes pa dag la rgyu mtshan dang rgyu mtshan can nyid 'thad pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: cig car skyes pa dag la rgyu mtshan dang rgyu mtshan can nyid 'thad pa yang ma yin te /
translated: It is also not tenable that they are the reason and the one arisen from the reason if they arise simultaneously.

original: de yang zhes pa khas blangs nas skyon gzhan gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: de yang zhes pa khas blangs nas skyon gzhan gsungs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThat‚Äù refers to the assertion of the other error.

original: gang 'di dbang po'i 'jug pa nyams su myong ba gang sngon ma can dran pa'i rtogs pa de tshad mar bshad pa ma yin no zhes pa ste /
analyzed: gang 'di dbang po'i 'jug pa nyams su myong ba gang sngon ma can dran pa'i rtogs pa de tshad mar bshad pa ma yin no zhes pa ste /
translated: This is not the explanation that the realization of memory, which is the experience of the engagement of the sense faculties, is valid cognition.

original: de kho na ma tshang ba nyid do //
analyzed: de kho na ma tshang ba nyid do //
translated: That is the very incompleteness of reality.

original: 'o na 'dod pa la sogs pa rnams la ci ltar na dran pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na 'dod pa la sogs pa rnams la ci ltar na dran pa yin zhe na /
translated: Well then, how is it that there is memory of desire and so on?

original: gsungs pa / rang rig par bya ba nyid kyi phyir zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gsungs pa / rang rig par bya ba nyid kyi phyir zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: It is said, ‚ÄúBecause it is to be known by itself.‚Äù

original: 'dis ni 'di gsal bar byed de /
analyzed: 'dis ni 'di gsal bar byed de /
translated: This clarifies the following.

original: 'dod pa la sogs pa nye bar bkod pa ni rang la gnod pa'i ched du ba'i bya ba skyed pa ste /
analyzed: 'dod pa la sogs pa nye bar bkod pa ni rang la gnod pa'i ched du ba'i bya ba skyed pa ste /
translated: The presentation of desire and so on is the production of an action for the sake of harming oneself.

original: de ltar na kho bo cag gis rang gi rig par bya ba nyid du 'dod pa la sogs pa rnams khas blangs pa nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: de ltar na kho bo cag gis rang gi rig par bya ba nyid du 'dod pa la sogs pa rnams khas blangs pa nyid kyi phyir /
translated: Thus because we accept that desire and so on are to be known by themselves,

original: de la dran pa yang dag par 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de la dran pa yang dag par 'byung ngo //
translated: memory arises in regard to them.

original: khyod kyis ni de ltar de rnams khas ma blangs pa'i phyir de mi srid pa kho na'o //
analyzed: khyod kyis ni de ltar de rnams khas ma blangs pa'i phyir de mi srid pa kho na'o //
translated: But you do not accept that, and therefore it is impossible for you.

original: ci ste rang rig ba khas blang bar bya na /
analyzed: ci ste rang rig ba khas blang bar bya na /
translated: But if you accept reflexive awareness,

original: de'i tshe de yang mtshan nyid kyis ma bsdus pas so zhes pas de kho na nyung ba nyid do //
analyzed: de'i tshe de yang mtshan nyid kyis ma bsdus pas so zhes pas de kho na nyung ba nyid do //
translated: At that time, that [memory] is not included by the definition, so it is just a small point.

original: 'o na bstan bcos kyis dran pa nyid bsgrubs pa ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na bstan bcos kyis dran pa nyid bsgrubs pa ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: Well then, isn't memory itself established by the treatise?

original: gsungs pa / 'di ni long ba'i gom pa kho na ste zhes pa ji ltar long ba'i gom pa ma mthong ba sngon ma can rnam par 'god pa de bzhin du 'di'i yang tshad mas yongs su gcad par mngon bar rjod par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gsungs pa / 'di ni long ba'i gom pa kho na ste zhes pa ji ltar long ba'i gom pa ma mthong ba sngon ma can rnam par 'god pa de bzhin du 'di'i yang tshad mas yongs su gcad par mngon bar rjod par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is said: This is just the steps of the blind. Just as the steps of the blind, which are unseen by those who have no eyes, are arranged, so too this [memory] is expressed by valid cognition.

original: yang na tshig rnams long ba rnams te tshogs pa'i don can ma yin pa rnams dag gang la yod pa de de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: yang na tshig rnams long ba rnams te tshogs pa'i don can ma yin pa rnams dag gang la yod pa de de skad ces bya'o //
translated: Or, the words are blind, not having the meaning of a collection. That which has that is called that.

original: de ltar ni zhes pa la sogs pas long ba'i gom pa nyid ston par @72a * //
analyzed: de ltar ni zhes pa la sogs pas long ba'i gom pa nyid ston par @72a * //
translated: In that way, it is said, and so on, teaching just the steps of the blind.

original: byed de / gang gi phyir dbang po'i don la yang dran pa mi srid la /
analyzed: byed de / gang gi phyir dbang po'i don la yang dran pa mi srid la /
translated: Because memory is not possible even for the object of the sense faculties,üîΩand because it is not possible for the object of memory,

original: gang nyams su myong ba ni ci slar yang nyams su myong ba ma yin pa'i 'jug pa rnams la yin nam zhes pa yang gi sgra'i don to //
analyzed: gang nyams su myong ba ni ci slar yang nyams su myong ba ma yin pa'i 'jug pa rnams la yin nam zhes pa yang gi sgra'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the word ‚Äúalso‚Äù is: ‚ÄúIs it the case that what is experienced is also experienced again by the cognitions?‚Äù

original: de ltar 'gyur mod /
analyzed: de ltar 'gyur mod /
translated: This is so,

original: dbang po'i zhen pa de yod na /
analyzed: dbang po'i zhen pa de yod na /
translated: but if there is the adherence of the sense faculty,

original: phyi rol gyi don kho na las yid kyis rjes su zhen par byed do zhes pa bstan bcos kyi don te /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi don kho na las yid kyis rjes su zhen par byed do zhes pa bstan bcos kyi don te /
translated: the meaning of the treatise is that the mental faculty adheres only to external objects.

original: de'i phyir nyams su myong ba ma yin pa nyid ma grub bo zhe na /
analyzed: de'i phyir nyams su myong ba ma yin pa nyid ma grub bo zhe na /
translated: Therefore, it is not established that it is not experienced.

original: gsungs pa / nyams pa'am zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: gsungs pa / nyams pa'am zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: To this he says, ‚ÄúIf it is lost, etc. ‚Äù

original: bstan bcos kyi nyams pa'o //
analyzed: bstan bcos kyi nyams pa'o //
translated: The treatise is lost.

original: gzhan mthong ba na dran pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan mthong ba na dran pa ste /
translated: When another sees, there is memory.

original: dbang po'i 'jug pas nyams su myong ba nyid kyi phyir dang yid kyis kyang dran par bya ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: dbang po'i 'jug pas nyams su myong ba nyid kyi phyir dang yid kyis kyang dran par bya ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because it is experienced by the engagement of the sense faculty and because it is remembered by the mental faculty.

original: de yang mi rigs te lhas byin gyis nyams su myong ba mchod sbyin gyis dran pa ni ma yin pas so //
analyzed: de yang mi rigs te lhas byin gyis nyams su myong ba mchod sbyin gyis dran pa ni ma yin pas so //
translated: This also is not correct, because Yajnadatta does not remember what Devadatta experienced.

original: 'o na rang gi lugs la dbang po'i shes pas nyams su myong ba yid kyis dran ba zhes pa ci ltar yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na rang gi lugs la dbang po'i shes pas nyams su myong ba yid kyis dran ba zhes pa ci ltar yin zhe na /
translated: Well then, what is the Sautrantika position on the memory of what was experienced by a sense consciousness?

original: 'di ni pha rol po kho na'i skyon te /
analyzed: 'di ni pha rol po kho na'i skyon te /
translated: This is a fault only for the opponent.

original: gang zhig gi gzhan gyis nyams su myong ba gzhan gyis dran pa ma yin no zhes pa 'di 'dod pa'i'o //
analyzed: gang zhig gi gzhan gyis nyams su myong ba gzhan gyis dran pa ma yin no zhes pa 'di 'dod pa'i'o //
translated: For it is the opponent who believes that what was experienced by one thing cannot be remembered by another.

original: kho bo cag ni rgyud gcig la shes pa gzhan gyis nyams su myong ba yang dran no zhes 'dod pas skyon med do //üîΩnyams su ma myong ba la dran pa'am zhes pa /
analyzed: kho bo cag ni rgyud gcig la shes pa gzhan gyis nyams su myong ba yang dran no zhes 'dod pas skyon med do // nyams su ma myong ba la dran pa'am zhes pa /
translated: We, however, believe that what was experienced by one consciousness in the same continuum can be remembered by another consciousness.üîΩWe are therefore without fault.üîΩIf you say that memory is of something not experienced,

original: ci ste yid kho nas nyams su ma myong ba dran par 'dod na /
analyzed: ci ste yid kho nas nyams su ma myong ba dran par 'dod na /
translated: if you assert that memory is of something not experienced by the mental consciousness,

original: de ltar yin na nyams su ma myong ba'i don la dran par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar yin na nyams su ma myong ba'i don la dran par 'gyur te /
translated: then memory would be of an object not previously experienced.

original: de ni yid kyis sngar nyams sum myong ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni yid kyis sngar nyams sum myong ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: This is because the mental consciousness did not experience it previously.

original: skad cig gnyis pa la yid 'dod do zhes pa 'di'i phyir dbang po'i 'jug pa dang lhan cig skyes pa'o zhe na gsungs pa /
analyzed: skad cig gnyis pa la yid 'dod do zhes pa 'di'i phyir dbang po'i 'jug pa dang lhan cig skyes pa'o zhe na gsungs pa /
translated: If you say that the second moment of the mental consciousness is what desires the object, then you are saying that memory is simultaneous with the operation of the sense consciousness.

original: ji skad bshad pa'i zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: ji skad bshad pa'i zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: As it has been explained.

original: bstan bcos su bshad ba ci phyi rol gyi don rnams la dbang po dang yid dag gis lhan cig zhen nam zhe na /
analyzed: bstan bcos su bshad ba ci phyi rol gyi don rnams la dbang po dang yid dag gis lhan cig zhen nam zhe na /
translated: Do the faculties and mind simultaneously apprehend external objects?

original: ma yin zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: ma yin zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: It should be said that they do not.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: don gcig byed pa'i dbang po dag rtog pa na nus pa nyid ma yin no zhes pa'o //
analyzed: don gcig byed pa'i dbang po dag rtog pa na nus pa nyid ma yin no zhes pa'o //
translated: The faculties do not have the capacity to conceive of a single object.

original: 'di skad bshad par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di skad bshad par 'gyur te /
translated: This is explained as follows.

original: gal te dbang po dang yid dag gnyis po dag gis kyang phyi rol gyi don 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid kyi 'bras bu don gcig byed pa nyid du 'dod na /
analyzed: gal te dbang po dang yid dag gnyis po dag gis kyang phyi rol gyi don 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid kyi 'bras bu don gcig byed pa nyid du 'dod na /
translated: If it is accepted that the faculties and mind, these two, produce a single effect that is the apprehension of external objects,

original: de ltar gyur na /
analyzed: de ltar gyur na /
translated: then in that case

original: dbang po rnams kyi nus pa nyid mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: dbang po rnams kyi nus pa nyid mi 'gyur te /
translated: the faculties would not have the capacity to conceive of a single object.

original: don dang ldan pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: don dang ldan pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro zhes pa'i don to //
translated: They would not be associated with objects.

original: gnyis ka dag gis yang phyi rol gyi don 'dzin pa @72b ni 'dir don gcig byed pa nyid do //
analyzed: gnyis ka dag gis yang phyi rol gyi don 'dzin pa @72b ni 'dir don gcig byed pa nyid do //
translated: The apprehension of external objects by both is here the production of a single effect.

original: gnyis ka dag gis kyang phyi rol gyi don 'dzin pa'i phyir dbang po rnams don dang ldan par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gnyis ka dag gis kyang phyi rol gyi don 'dzin pa'i phyir dbang po rnams don dang ldan par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: And since both of them grasp external objects, the sense faculties are not endowed with objects.

original: ci ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ci ltar zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: gal te re zhig phyi rol gyi yul 'jug bzhin pa'i yid ni dbang po'i 'jug pas phan btags pa byas ba la ltos ba med na /
analyzed: gal te re zhig phyi rol gyi yul 'jug bzhin pa'i yid ni dbang po'i 'jug pas phan btags pa byas ba la ltos ba med na /
translated: If the mind that engages with external objects does not depend on the help of the sense faculties,

original: de ltar gyur na dbang po rnams rnam pa thams cad du don med pa nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar gyur na dbang po rnams rnam pa thams cad du don med pa nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: then the sense faculties would be completely useless.

original: yid kho na phyi rol gyi don nye bar 'dzin pa'i phyir skyes bu'i nye bar longs spyod pa 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yid kho na phyi rol gyi don nye bar 'dzin pa'i phyir skyes bu'i nye bar longs spyod pa 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the mind alone grasps external objects, and the enjoyment of a person is established.

original: dbang po'i 'jug pa phyi rol gyi don du snang ba rnams kyang yid kyi zhen pa rnams kyis zhen par ma byas pa rnams dang de rnams dang ma 'dus pa rnams dang rtog pa med pa rnams su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dbang po'i 'jug pa phyi rol gyi don du snang ba rnams kyang yid kyi zhen pa rnams kyis zhen par ma byas pa rnams dang de rnams dang ma 'dus pa rnams dang rtog pa med pa rnams su 'gyur ro //
translated: The engagement of the sense faculties in the appearance of external objects would not be conceptualized by the mind, would not be conceptualized by those, and would not be conceptualized by those who are not included in that.

original: gang yang sgo dang sgo can rnam par dpyad par bshad pa 'di ste /
analyzed: gang yang sgo dang sgo can rnam par dpyad par bshad pa 'di ste /
translated: Also, this analysis of the door and the possessor of the door was explained.

original: yid la gcig tu 'gyur ba'i dbang po'i zhen pa rnams skyes bus sems par byed de /
analyzed: yid la gcig tu 'gyur ba'i dbang po'i zhen pa rnams skyes bus sems par byed de /
translated: The mental adherence is produced by the person who reflects on the adherence of the sense faculties.

original: dbang po'i zhen pa rnams kyis yid kyi zhen pa rnams ni ma yin no zhes pa'o //
analyzed: dbang po'i zhen pa rnams kyis yid kyi zhen pa rnams ni ma yin no zhes pa'o //
translated: The mental adherence is not produced by the adherence of the sense faculties.

original: de'i phyir yid kho na sgo can dang sgo ni dbang po rnams so zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir yid kho na sgo can dang sgo ni dbang po rnams so zhes pa'o //
translated: Therefore, only the mind is the door and the sense faculties are the doors.

original: de yang rnam par nyams te /
analyzed: de yang rnam par nyams te /
translated: But that is not so.

original: cig car don gcig byed pa nyid na gnyis ka dag kyang sgo dang sgo can nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: cig car don gcig byed pa nyid na gnyis ka dag kyang sgo dang sgo can nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: If they were to function simultaneously in the production of a single effect, then both would be the door and the one having the door.

original: long ba la sogs pa rnams kyi yang gzugs la sogs pa'i yul mngon sum du 'gyur ro //üîΩci ste yang dbang pos byas pa'i phan 'dogs pa la ltos nas phyi rol gyi don la yid rab tu 'jug pa 'ba' zhig pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: long ba la sogs pa rnams kyi yang gzugs la sogs pa'i yul mngon sum du 'gyur ro // ci ste yang dbang pos byas pa'i phan 'dogs pa la ltos nas phyi rol gyi don la yid rab tu 'jug pa 'ba' zhig pa ni ma yin te /
translated: And the blind, etc., would perceive visible form, etc.

original: nus pa med pa'i phyir zhes brjod par bya zhe na /
analyzed: nus pa med pa'i phyir zhes brjod par bya zhe na /
translated: But if you say that the mind does not enter into the external object alone, but in dependence on the assistance provided by the sense faculty, because it is not capable of doing so by itself,

original: de lta na yang dbang po rnams nus pa can du 'gyur ba ma yin pa kho na'o //
analyzed: de lta na yang dbang po rnams nus pa can du 'gyur ba ma yin pa kho na'o //
translated: then the sense faculties would not be capable of providing assistance.

original: gang gi phyir de ltar 'dod pa na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar 'dod pa na /
translated: Because of that, when you assert that,

original: rkyen dang bcas pa'i 'jug pa mi srid par 'gyur te /
analyzed: rkyen dang bcas pa'i 'jug pa mi srid par 'gyur te /
translated: the engagement of the sense faculties together with their conditions is impossible.

original: dbang po'i 'jug par mar me'i 'od bzhin du lhan cig byed pa nyid du nges par gnas pa na /
analyzed: dbang po'i 'jug par mar me'i 'od bzhin du lhan cig byed pa nyid du nges par gnas pa na /
translated: When the engagement of the sense faculties is definitely present as the cooperating condition, like the light of a lamp,

original: yid kho na phyi rol gyi don la 'dzin pa'i ched du rab tu 'jug pas so //
analyzed: yid kho na phyi rol gyi don la 'dzin pa'i ched du rab tu 'jug pas so //
translated: only the mind engages for the purpose of apprehending external objects.

original: de la ji ltar sgron me'i 'od yod pa na /
analyzed: de la ji ltar sgron me'i 'od yod pa na /
translated: In that regard, just as when the light of a lamp exists,

original: mig 'jug ste mar me'i 'od ni lhan cig byed pa kho na 'ba' zhig yin pa de ltar dbang po'i 'jug pa yod pa na yid phyi rol gyi don la 'dzin pa'i ched du 'jug ste /
analyzed: mig 'jug ste mar me'i 'od ni lhan cig byed pa kho na 'ba' zhig yin pa de ltar dbang po'i 'jug pa yod pa na yid phyi rol gyi don la 'dzin pa'i ched du 'jug ste /
translated: the eye engages, and the light of the lamp is only the cooperating condition, in the same way, when the engagement of the sense faculties exists, the mind engages for the purpose of apprehending external objects.

original: dbang po'i 'jug pa ni lhan cig byed pa kho na'o //
analyzed: dbang po'i 'jug pa ni lhan cig byed pa kho na'o //
translated: The engagement of the sense faculties is only the cooperating condition.

original: de yang yid kyi 'jug pas gzung bar bya ba ma yin pas ma 'dus @73a * //
analyzed: de yang yid kyi 'jug pas gzung bar bya ba ma yin pas ma 'dus @73a * //
translated: Moreover, since that is not apprehended by the engagement of the mind, it is not included.

original: pa rkyen med pa kho nar thams cad kyi tshe 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: pa rkyen med pa kho nar thams cad kyi tshe 'gyur ba'o //
translated: It is only without conditions, and it occurs at all times.

original: dbang po zhen pa rnams kyang yid la gcig tu 'gyur pa las don dang ldan pa nyid du brjod kyi /
analyzed: dbang po zhen pa rnams kyang yid la gcig tu 'gyur pa las don dang ldan pa nyid du brjod kyi /
translated: Also, the faculties of those who are attached are transformed into a single mind, and they are said to be endowed with a purpose.

original: rnam pa gzhan du ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan du ni ma yin no //
translated: But not otherwise.

original: des na de rnams gal te yid kyi zhen pa rnams kyis rjes su zhen par byed na /
analyzed: des na de rnams gal te yid kyi zhen pa rnams kyis rjes su zhen par byed na /
translated: Therefore, if those faculties are subsequently attached by the mind‚Äôs attachment,

original: de lta na yid la gcig tu gyur pa rnams skyes bu can gyis yang dag par rig par byed de /
analyzed: de lta na yid la gcig tu gyur pa rnams skyes bu can gyis yang dag par rig par byed de /
translated: then the mind‚Äôs single transformation is cognized by the person.

original: de las kyang de dang yang dag par 'dus pa rnams de'i ngo bo nyid bzhin du skyes pa rnams tshad ma nyid du rab tu rtogs par bya ste /
analyzed: de las kyang de dang yang dag par 'dus pa rnams de'i ngo bo nyid bzhin du skyes pa rnams tshad ma nyid du rab tu rtogs par bya ste /
translated: And from that, those that are combined with that are understood to be valid cognitions, just like its nature.

original: gzhan du na de rnams tshad ma nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan du na de rnams tshad ma nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, they would not be valid cognitions.

original: gang rnams kyang rkyen med pa'i 'jug pa tshad ma nyid du mngon par 'dod la /
analyzed: gang rnams kyang rkyen med pa'i 'jug pa tshad ma nyid du mngon par 'dod la /
translated: Those who assert that the engagement of the faculties without conditions is valid cognition

original: rkyen dang bcas pa ni 'bras bur te /
analyzed: rkyen dang bcas pa ni 'bras bur te /
translated: and that with conditions is the resultüîΩare not correct.

original: de rnams kyi yang ji skad brjod pa'i rnam pas rtog pa dang bcas pa'i 'jug pa mi srid pa'i phyir 'bras bu med cing /
analyzed: de rnams kyi yang ji skad brjod pa'i rnam pas rtog pa dang bcas pa'i 'jug pa mi srid pa'i phyir 'bras bu med cing /
translated: Some say: Since it is impossible for them to engage with the aspects of those objects as they are described, they are fruitless.

original: de med pa'i phyir yang tshad ma yang med de /
analyzed: de med pa'i phyir yang tshad ma yang med de /
translated: And since they are fruitless, they are not valid knowledge.

original: 'bras bu med pa tshad mar rigs pa ni ma yin pas so zhes kha cig go //
analyzed: 'bras bu med pa tshad mar rigs pa ni ma yin pas so zhes kha cig go //
translated: It is not logical for something that is fruitless to be valid knowledge.

original: mig dang yid dag sgo dang sgo can gyi dngos po yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: mig dang yid dag sgo dang sgo can gyi dngos po yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Others say: Since the eyes and the mind are the door and the possessor of the door,

original: 'di dag don gcig byed par brtag pa'i nus pa bdag cag la yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di dag don gcig byed par brtag pa'i nus pa bdag cag la yod pa ma yin te /
translated: we cannot conceive that they function to perform the same purpose.

original: cig car don gcig byed pa nyid na gnyi ga dag kyang sgo dang sgo can nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes gzhan rnams so //
analyzed: cig car don gcig byed pa nyid na gnyi ga dag kyang sgo dang sgo can nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes gzhan rnams so //
translated: If they function to perform the same purpose, it follows that both would be the door and the possessor of the door.

original: skyon 'di med ces pa la sogs pas 'di sgrub par byed de /
analyzed: skyon 'di med ces pa la sogs pas 'di sgrub par byed de /
translated: Others prove this with no error and so on.

original: ma yin zhes pa'i dgag pa gang yin pa 'di ni /
analyzed: ma yin zhes pa'i dgag pa gang yin pa 'di ni /
translated: The negation in not is not

original: lhan cig tu zhen pa'i bya ba tsam 'gog pa ma yin gyi /
